description: Latin suppeditatus, past participle of suppeditare (“to supply”).

verbs.description: suppeditate (third-person singular simple present suppeditates, present participle suppeditating, simple past and past participle suppeditated)

examples: the pestilential , reigning , sweeping offence , on which all the lower train of petty faults do wait and depend , do minister and suppeditate matter to work
